result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:50 AM Defendant Jermaine L Moore appeared by video, in-custody, from Fox Lake Correctional.  Attorney Anna M Kees appeared by video for Jermaine L Moore. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense does not yet have discovery or an offer. Defense indicates that the Defendant wants to resolve case, and requests a plea/sentencing hearing in November. 
State forwards pre-trial offer. 
Court will set for plea/sentencing hearing, and will allow a remote appearance by the Defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:48 AM Defendant Jermaine L Moore appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Fox Lake Correctional.  State Public Defender Intern Erik Schlueter for Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Jermaine L Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Attorney Kees will make the request for the defendant to appear by Zoom from Fox Lake Correctional at the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
filed, to be produced from Fox Lake Correctional
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with T-Mobile listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:26 PM Defendant Jermaine L Moore appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Fox Lake Correctional with Public Defender Intern Erik Schlueter for Attorney Anna M Kees.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Fox Lake Correctional.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
